poem:
**Puggles in the Pouch**

Inside the warm marsupial cave,  
an echidna mother shifts her secret  
alchemy, crafting tiny shields  
of unseen microbes.  

Here, the blind puggle rests,  
curled like a tender thought  
in the quiet dark.  

A pink whisper of life, growing  
beneath the gentle hum  
of her care.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. These first few weeks are critical for puggles. At this early developmental stage, they are tiny – roughly the size of a 5-cent coin – and vulnerable. “They can’t see". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
